Reviews.Title: Great TV for the price!
Reviews.Author: Trevor Trumbo
Reviews.Content: After researching several television options, we decided on this Vizio smart LED TV. What interested us:* 120Hz refresh rate* Wi-Fi built in* LED screenSet up was very easy. The TV found our secure wireless SSID and it took maybe 15 seconds to have it connected to our home network. I wish the TV connected over the 5G band instead of the 2G but we haven't experienced any lag with Amazon Prime or Netflix.Connecting the TV to our home entertainment center was easy with the HDMI cable (not included). Our Harmony remote took about 2 minutes to update and was controlling the television soon after.Colors look bright and blacks are very black. I've tested the TV with our Blu-Ray player, HD programming via DirecTV, games from our Xbox 360, and movies from our Apple TV. No complaints from any source and the images look very sharp with excellent colors.

Reviews.Title: VIZIO is setting a new standard for excellence at a bargain price
Reviews.Author: Expressed Reviews "Expressed Reviews"
Reviews.Content: Over the course of the past 2 years; we've replaced all of our TV's with those manufactured by Vizio. Our first HDTV was a Samsung 40" that we purchased in 2007. Recently, a problem developed in one of the circuit boards, rendering the picture unwatchable. Since new TV's have come down so much in price; it wasn't worth spending the money to fix it. I've been so pleased with the performance of our other Vizio TV's, that I decided to purchase this one. Our Samsung fit into a cabinet that we wanted to use for our new Vizio, and we found that since the actual size of the TV is about the same as the Samsung; it fits into the cabinet perfectly. We also get an additional 2" of screen, which makes a difference. Setting up this TV is a breeze, and to say that I'm satisfied with its performance would be an understatement. What I especially like is the ability to watch football games without having to see a blur when the players are running down the field. I'm no expert when it comes to technology, but I think that this has something to do with the increased refresh rate over older model TV's. All I know is that the picture is magnificent and crystal clear, the speakers are decent(I'll be connecting my own), and the Internet Apps are out of this world. It takes just a few minutes to set up a wireless Internet connection, and once done: you have access to an endless array of movies, TV shows and apps from many different sources. I'm so impressed with this TV that I have nothing negative to say about it. It has everything that I was looking for, was easy to set up, and works flawlessly. I couldn't ask for anything more.

Reviews.Title: Great for the price
Reviews.Author: Robert A. Cotterman-nelson "Robert C"
Reviews.Content: First I want to say the CONs.1. It is LED-LCD Which means black levels are not that great. It is an amazing picture, and the contrast is great, but the black levels are sub par compared to my old 720 plasma. But that is expected.2. The Sound, It is ok. you can deal but it is nothing to call mom about, I wouldnt buy this by it self. Either spend a bit more on a tv with amazing sound, or spend the money on a sound bar. The sound works, and the surround sound understanding and output is good. (you can hear the birds in the background on avatar etc..) but its just 2 measly 8w speakers.3. The setup. OMG it takes for ever to figure out, and if you dont know what you are doing, it takes way too long. I will share my set up later.Now for the PRO's1. Price. 499+Tax for 42 inches with 120hz and 1080p... Phenomenal.2. Picture detail. The detail (when set up) is superb. At least when matched with a blu ray quality movie. Gamer(the movie) just rocks your socks off.3. Features for price. The features are awesome. The one con is no blue-tooth and no keyboard remote. I dont use the remote to type much, but when I do I wish i had the keyboard for that. I'd recommend the m420sl model by them for 50$ more. However you lose back lit LED for the Edge lit in the m420sl. Anyhow this tv has truvolume which is awesome for movies at night, or around sleeping babies, and or commercial blares. However it doesnt pass through the optical out. So if your sound system doesnt have truvolume, it's a lost feature. The apps are fun, and neat. They load fast enough, and respond 99-100% of the time. Netflix takes a bit to load, but when searching you can hit left right up and down and even if it pauses for a second, all your button presses were registered. (my blu ray player bdp2900/f7 has the slowest netflix on earth).... HDMI CEC is awesome, i have never had it in a set up before, and it is amazing. Controlling the blu ray player with the tv remote is so easy to set up, and it rules! Now just to buy a sound bar with HDMI ARC...Additional Info...Setup.My setup is along the following lines.Backlight (as low as you can handle)Brightness - 42 (minimum my tv goes before losing black detail)Contrast - 67 (max my tv goes before losing white detail)Color  - 60Tint - 0Sharpness - 9Advanced colors - custom - all at 50. (for vibrance)otherwise i put it on natural and left it. you dont notice, and it seems more real after you get use to itLuma to strong or extend.MPG NR - offNoise reduction - offColor to color rich.Film mode to auto (this ensures 24hz is seen) (my bluray player is best at 1080p NOT 1080p/24hz the first removes all judder)im not set on smart dimming yet, i think i prefer it on. But on can incur mild flashing. Off is more "stable" or "consistent"and auto backlight off.Here is a forum I found judder test files. [...]Just placed em on a thumb drive or hard drive I attached to my blu-ray player and tweaked all the settings until 30 and 23.976 both "panned" smoothly. If they are hopping every couple frames. Then you need to keep tweaking.

Reviews.Title: Solid for the Price, but could be MUCH  better.
Reviews.Author: joshua castonguay
Reviews.Content: I have had this TV for about 4 months now and think it's time to write a review on the product.First, I am not sure you could do better for the price, so that alone is reason to buy the TV.  If you're not tech geek or just need a sharp looking LED with some fancy apps then stop reading and go get the thing.BUT, if you want more from it then keep reading.Vizio really is dropping the ball with their app selection and some apps are pure garbage.  The apps are bulky - difficult to navigate and on top that unresponsive more often than not.  The Youtube app is atrocious and isn't worth much at all.  Most content is blocked to be viewed on the display and the search ability is terrible.  The Vimeo app seems to an afterthought and is 100% trash, don't even open it.  The Hulu app lags, lags, and lags some more making it frustrating beyond belief.  Their is no internet browser....Very Lame.  And Yahoo being in cahoots with the company makes the light at the end of the tunnel looking mighty dim.PROS- The Price!- Looks Great- Picture is Top notch- USB?- It has Apps....- Remote is cool when it's responsiveCONS- Garbage Apps- LAG- LAG- Keep waiting for those Apps to load

Reviews.Title: It's No Samsung But Great For The Price
Reviews.Author: Cautious Consumer "Cautious Consumer"
Reviews.Content: If money was of no concern, I'd have purchased a Samsung. But I was limited this year like so many others. I found that this particular Vizio had everything I was looking for at a reasonable price. Yes I do know that all the manufacturers will be soon coming out with even better features BUT, you buy what you buy when you need it most. A resister went out on my older set and I had no other screen to watch. But I did my research none the less and finally found this out of so many versions. It fit my budget and the quality of the picture can't be beat at this price. With WiFi to boot, I can watch NetFlix and save a bundle over the cost of Satellite or Cable TV packages. I do find however that I must turn off the power and back on again when I loose my wifi signal. This isn't a Vizio only problem as I do it for my Samsung Bluray as well. Perhaps if I had a direct cable to the units it wouldn't be a factor. Nevertheless, best Vizio version for the money!-Update 1/22/2013-I understand why some people rated this item very low. It is because they did not really try to intelligently adjust the picture which can take a very long time (days of experimentation). Why not just try the settings people have published here. I did, and was shocked that I thought I now had a far more expensive tv. Shocked that Vizio doesn't make factory settings better *must be a reason??? My only personal comparison is my friend's 60" Samsung where you actually see pores in people's skin which is just too freaky for me to enjoy in some movies. But after making the changes as noted by another reviewer here, my smaller 42" screen looks as good as my friend's 60" theater set. He spent three weeks experimenting on his Samsung's picture settings and is now very happy. I suggest everyone here do the same because this Vizio is quite capable!

Reviews.Title: All the features I'd been waiting for, gorgeous & smart!
Reviews.Author: Bectile "bectile"
Reviews.Content: I did not buy this from Amazon because they were out of stock at the time (December) but I wanted to review it here because I am absolutely in love with my TV and want to defend it against the poor reviews I see on here. :)I purchased this TV to replace an aged LCD flatscreen and was looking for a lot of features, including LED backlighting for energy efficiency, lightweight to mount on the wall, high refresh rate, smart dimming, customizable settings, and the ability to play Netflix. I found all this and more with this TV.One important thing to note when adjusting the picture settings is that the TV will have different advanced settings for EACH MODE. You need to edit the advanced settings for each mode while using that mode. Yes this may be a pain, but it can be a bonus, because the cable TV input may look much different than the Blu-ray, etc, and you can make a mode for each one.The picture does need adjusting to really POP.. the default settings are a bit washed-out. I used the movie "Princess Bride" to play with the settings, and I read other people's recommendations. I started with "Movie Mode". I found that turning OFF the ambient light sensor immediately improved the picture. I set the "Adaptive Luma" setting to "Strong" which deepens the dark areas providing more contrast. And I changed the "Color Enhancement" to "Rich color" which made skin tones warm and more alive.I changed the "Color Temperarure" to "Cool" because it was a bit TOO warm but then I thought it was a bit too green, so I made my own custom Color Temperature: Red Gain 42, Green Gain 45, Blue Gain 50, Red Offset 55, Green Offset 50, Blue Offset 50.I was happy to have so many options, the Picture settings are extremely customizable so I don't see why people can't get what they want. Please feel free to try my settings and see if it helps with flesh tones and colors in general. I consider these adjustments a "work in progress" and I plan to play with each input having a mode to suit it.The sound is great, by the way. I have it set on surround and it is pretty rich. I swear it has directionality and is much  better than other flat screens I've listened to.I set up the Wi-fi but have a LAN connection so I don't use it and can't review its stability or speed. My only real complaint about this TV is it seems a little slow to connect to the input you select, having to gather information first before showing a picture. The split second delay is something I'm not used to, never having had an HDMI connection before. It may be my old cables, but not worth replacing them.In summary, I've had this TV for a month and have been watching all my old favorite movies on it, and it makes me feel like I'm in a theater again! Netflix, blu-ray and my digital tuner are all gorgeous on it. Netflix loads much quicker than my old bluray player's interface, by the way. I'm really happy with this TV and have enjoyed customizing the settings to my liking.

Reviews.Title: LOVE IT!!
Reviews.Author: DMarie
Reviews.Content: To say I am extremely satisfied with this tv is an understatement. Easy to set-up...took less than 15 minutes.  The picture and sound are excellent...crisp and very clear! So far, the wifi (and apps) all work well...Average loading time.  It's a great tv to watch a live sports game on...No fuzziness or lag time as I've experienced with other tvs.I researched tvs for a few weeks before I opted to purchase this tv and I still haven't found a deal as good as this one, especially given the great quality.  I highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: VIZIO E420i-A1 42-inch 1080p 120Hz LED Smart HDTV
Reviews.Author: Mark
Reviews.Content: I read some reviews regarding the picture and sound quality and the sound is fine. Yes it would sound better through a surround sound system, but for stock sound it isn't bad. The Smart TV set up was easy and my wife is all over the Netflix! This is my first LED and the picture on the LCD in the living room is brighter so I'm playing with the settings to see if I can improve the quality. All in all for the price, size of screen, and it's a Smart TV, this is a very nice deal.

Reviews.Title: No smooth motion - characteristic of 120Hz
Reviews.Author: C. Angel
Reviews.Content: Nearly every 120Hz LED has smooth motion capabilities. Sure, not everyone likes it, but it's possible to make it optional on most 120Hz HDTVs. This TV abandons that entirely. No option for the end user making the TV act like a 60Hz TV.Pros:- Size for the money is pretty good.- Completely LED (not mixed LCD/LED like so many others in this price range)- 3 HDMIs on this price range TV is HARD to find.- Super THIN.- Base is nice, glossy, and sturdy.Cons:- Claims to be 120Hz, but acts like 60Hz - if you don't care, then purchase a slightly cheaper HDTV at 60Hz. Same quality.- Colors can be difficult to manage from one device to the next. Looks "dim" when it shouldn't. It's hit and miss on appropriate colors.- Remote is pretty obnoxious. Buttons are difficult to push and the "Amazon," "Netflix," and "M-Go" buttons aren't that useful since it literally takes to clicks to get to those without those buttons. ALSO, the M-Go app doesn't even work yet! "Coming soon."- App selection is OK, but the user interface is SLOW and BULKY. Response time is awful. My advice? Get a Roku.- No DLNA?! Why not?! Vizio had this on all the A0 versions, but not this one? The 3d version of the A1 even has it. That was a careless decision.- 2x8w speakers on this version. A0 had 2x10w. Not a huge deal, but the older version had some better specs, but isn't available on Amazon anymore.- Takes way too long to turn on - or maybe I'm just not used to LED TVs.In the end, I would recommend you get a 60Hz with better specs elsewhere for the same cost. You won't "see" the 120Hz in this TV since they removed all hints of it. Perhaps Vizio was catering to people who don't like the "Opera" or "PAL" look found in smooth motion 120Hz HDTVs, but it would have been easy to make it optional for this. If you want a "smart" TV, get a Roku or netbox or something else with faster response time and more apps with ACTIVE developers.It's a good TV, but could have been about $50 - $100 cheaper given the fact that the TV doesn't really live up to its specifications for 120Hz.

Reviews.Title: The unexpected five star review
Reviews.Author: Dugong
Reviews.Content: Well, I don't normally give 5-star reviews because, hell's bells, there ain't nothin' perfect; so I suppose this tv probably would have got 4 stars from me yesterday morning but I'm giving it 5-stars today because I'm pretty delighted with it.The main reason I'm so happy is because last night I plugged an external HDD into it and it could read the .AVI files on it just fine ad it played back video perfectly. Tonight I'm happy because I plugged in a USB stick and the tv played back an .MP4 file perfectly. It's much more than I was expecting from this tv, to be honest. Indeed, the full user manual (which doesn't come with the tv, but has to be downloaded) explicitly says that it WON'T play DVDs or movies from a USB or HDD (not sure why, but I guess Vizio have their reasons). Anyway, I'm very pleased so far.On other matters, the tv seems to work well so far. It was very easy to set up. Connected to wireless perfectly, and fairly easily. It starts up reasonably quickly (though not as fast as I would like). I've been using the Netflix app a bit and it does fine. I bought it primarily for the 1080p / 120Hz resolution and I'm pleased with that. The sound quality is pretty good too, though I intend to hook it up to speaker system in the not too distant future so that shouldn't matter too much.All in all, I think it's a good tv, and the fact that it can read an external HDD/USB wins the 5-star rating, though if it hadn't been for that I'd have probably only given 4 stars, because I don't think it's as pretty to look at as some of the other TVs one can spend their money on.

Reviews.Title: great TV!
Reviews.Author: Stephen
Reviews.Content: I upgraded from a 720p 60Hz Sony Bravia and this TV looks fantastic!  Very great deal for the $500 price.  Lots of settings to choose from, picture is nice and sharp.  Would be interested in seeing some of your custom image settings if you're willing to provide them.  Thanks!

Reviews.Title: Terrible Support from Vizio. Netflix & Amazon Video DOES NOT WORK.
Reviews.Author: The Q "Q"
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV expressly to use with WiFi and Netflix.  I went through the set-up, configured the TV to connect to my WiFi net, and Netflix and Amazon both failed saying "Not Connected to Internet".  I called Amazon tech support, and they finally transferred me to Vizio.  After two days, we are no closer to a fix.  All the other internet apps work fine, so it's not a connectivity issue, but Vizio told me to connect it via Ethernet cable for TWO DAYS to see if that fixes it.  I didn't buy a WiFi TV so that I could connect it to a cable!  The Vizio tech is completely unknowlegeable and is going by some cookbook troubleshooting gude.  They don't listen to reason or logic, just go through each stupid step.  They said my TV is not connecting to their "server", but she couldn't even tell me the domain name of the server so I could check my router log.  Anyway, still no Netflix, and I am TOTALLY UNHAPPY WITH VIZIO.  I will update this if the problem is resolved.UPDATE:  After 48 hours connected to Ethernet, the TV still won't play Netflix or Amazon.  Vizio now says the TV is broken, but since I bought it through a third party Amazon vendor that the warranty is invalid.  From bad to worse.  Now I either need to pay $50 to ship it back to the vendor and hope for a good set, or I'm stuck with a Netflix ready TV that DOES NOT CONNECT TO NETFLIX!UPDATE2:  The third party Amazon vendor has agreed to exchange the TV at no charge and pay all shipping.  I'm unsure if the problem will be fixed, but I'm happy about that part.  I will update a final time to let you know if TV #2 works as advertised.FINAL UPDATE:  Vizio Techincal support is an oxymoron.  They couldn't support anything technical if their company depended on it.  And it does.  Anyway, I returned the set and now 11 days later, they are shipping me another.  I have little faith that a new one will act any differently.  I imagine I will get a Blu-Ray player with built-in Netflix to actually use Netflix on my "Netflix-ready" Vizio.UPDATE AFTER SET #2:  Netflix now works thanks to the dealer that replaced the set for me.  It took 10 days, but all is well no thanks to Vizio "tech" support.  I did not change my rating.  When a company has such overtly horrible support, I just can't give them a rating other than one star.

Reviews.Title: Amazing Full HDTV For the Price!
Reviews.Author: waterandland
Reviews.Content: Absolutely amazed about the picture quality and everything else. Especially, for the price!You cannot find an LED full HDTV 120Mhz system for the money!  The quality is absolutely amazing.  The colors are rich. I have had this TV now for about 1 1/2 weeks and I am  thrilled. This is my first HDTV system.  I have fully checked the prices on this TV and no one has a better price for this TV but  Amazon.  If you order it from Amazon it's currently on $499 plus tax. If you are a Prime member the shipping is free.  I would advise not to buy this  TV from anyone else  who sales it for more as they are selling it over the retail price.  Amazon and Vizio direct has the best deal.  If it's on back order from Amazon its worth the wait.  I ordered mine that was initially on back order and it arrived quite quickly.  So, it's worth it.  Many other HDTVs  sale for a lot more.  LED is the best  picture currently for a full HDTV.  120 Mhz  is a fantastic refresh rate.  I would not go under 120 Mhz.  Spending a few extra $ for 120 Mhz LED or LCD system is worth it.  240Mhz is over rated.  All you need is 120 Mhz  for LED or LCD system.UPDATE:  I purchased this Vizio back in late November 2012.  I've had the HDTV now for 9 months.  Still a great TV for the price. If any downside,  it does take little while for the TV to load. (Approximately 45 seconds to 1 minute).  Overall, great picture.  Though,  would be nice if the contrast was a bit better.  Overall,  I'm still quite happy with the purchase. For the price, you cannot complain. Worth making the purchase.  Hope this update helps.

Reviews.Title: Great looking TV for the price
Reviews.Author: iSoar
Reviews.Content: To allow the TV to look as good as it can you will need to turn off all of the preset stuff.  After we did this the color and picture looked great.

Reviews.Title: Excellent unit; easy to set up; good value
Reviews.Author: Tcomplex "John S"
Reviews.Content: As some others have written, this unit is very easy to set up out of the box. I used HDMI connection to Cable box, follow the initial setup instruction onscreen to connect to my WiFi network, and was finished in minutes.The picture is excellent, and I like the minimalist design that is essentially all picture.Two minor quibbles: 1) the remote feels flimsy and is not programmable at all, as far as I can tell.  Also, unlike another Vizio I have, there is no Bluetooth connectivity, and no keyboard, so entering passwords for things like Hulu (although you only need to do it once), requires using arrows to scroll an onscreen keyboard.  2) The box has Quickstart instructions only.  Full TV instructions must be retrieved as a pdf online (not that you need them).I believe that overall this is a great value for the newest LED technology and modernistic design.  HIGHLY recommend.

Reviews.Title: amazing
Reviews.Author: starfinabelle
Reviews.Content: Definately more bang for your buck! Best purchase I've made in a long time. I highly recommend this TV especially for the smart features

Reviews.Title: Junk!
Reviews.Author: Sonia M. Teran
Reviews.Content: After less than 5 months the TV monitor has red vertical lines all over it. The lines come and go but are very noticeable when they are present.

Reviews.Title: WiFi Work-Around but Good TV
Reviews.Author: hsparks
Reviews.Content: Fisrt off, I bought the TV elsewhere but I thought I'd pass along some info.Unboxing and physical setup was easy.  The TV configuration/setup was also easy until I tried to connect the wifi to my router.  I could not connect to my router wirelessly even with Vizio's tech support helping.  Because of concerns about security and evidence of squatters on my network I did not broadcast my SSID and and required a password.  The TV would eventually 'see' my network but entering my alpha-numeric, upper/lower case password did not work.  Moving my access point right next to the TV made no difference.What did work i.e., "the fix" was to disable all security on my router and to also broadcast the SSID.  As an indirect nod to security, I also set my router to only allow devices to connect that were listed by their MAC address including the TV. Once I did this, the TV immediately connected after turning it off and then back on.  All I had to do was enter my SSID (network name) when I turned it back on.Other Notes:The TV did connect to internet with no problems when using a network cable to my router but I had to string a cable to the next room and across the floor so this was only temporary.The buttons on the remote are a little crowded but I can live with it.*Undocumented Funtion*  You can connect and use a USB computer keyboard to the TV simply by plugging it into the USB port.  It makes text entry and search functions much easier than trying to use the remote or the on-screen keyboard.I set the video to "movie mode".  This makes the images pop without requiring a lot of fussing.Even though I eventually found the fix to my problem on my own, I thought the American based Vizio tech support to be helpful and very willing to work with me.Generally, I am pleased with this TV and would put Vizio on my short list if I need another TV.

Reviews.Title: this tv sucks
Reviews.Author: Shawn
Reviews.Content: I have only had this tv for a week. I've never had a smart tv so I was really excited to have one and it was pretty inexpensive. But the crappy tv keeps shutting off by itself. I try to load netflix, or even the help guide and the tv just powers off. piece of junk.

Reviews.Title: Terrible business
Reviews.Author: Stephen
Reviews.Content: Bought the TV at the end of March been working fine until yesterday. Ordering and delivery were 4 star. Now, for the first 5 to 10 minutes that the TV is on it shuts off every minute. Vizio will not honor the warranty. The company that sold it through amazon said I need to ship to them and be without a TV for a month or two. Will never purchase a Vizio or through Electronics101deals or whatever those scammers names are!!!

Reviews.Title: Cool idea but needs more work
Reviews.Author: Betty White "KASH2006"
Reviews.Content: We went cable-free about 18 months ago. We watch some stuff via an antenna but most of our viewing is in the form of streaming video. We've been using this thing for about four months. For the price I suppose it was the best option without excess wires but it's not perfect by any means. It's not uncommon for the thing to freeze up or crash. There are times when none of the buttons respond. However, I wouldn't say it's a daily problem but it's not like it has only happened 2 or 3 times either. Just be forewarned, there are still plenty of bugs in this technology.The apps end to be slow to respond and a lot less user friendly than apps on other devices I own. Netflix is decent for our needs. We're usually accessing our content via the "Recently Watched" section so that's not hard to navigate. Of all of the apps, it's probably the closest to functioning like the computer-based version.We occasionally use Amazon Prime streaming but you do have to pay close attention that you are choosing a movie that's included with Prime vs. something you have to pay extra for. The YouTube app is pretty awful. It doesn't access your viewing history, won't let you navigate through the individual videos in a playlist (as in I can't jump right to video 11 of 18 in a list), nor can you scroll through the videos of the channels you're subscribed too. Even the search doesn't really deliver optimal results. In my opinion, the only way to make use of YouTube on here is to create a playlist on a computer and then watch it via the TV.I do love some things about this TV though. We can plug in a flash drive and play many types of media without putting a PC and HDMI in between. (Although weirdly I have a jump drive with about 15 videos on it all in the same format, created the same way and one of them will not play on the TV.) There's an app called "Media Center" that will connect to the PCs on our wireless network to steam content from them. That means that any pictures, music and videos on computers can be accessed wirelessly. We used this to play a photo slideshow set to music for a birthday party.All in all, it's an ok product for the price. There's definitely a lot of room for improvement with this technology but at least we only have to deal with the power cord instead of a jumble of wires.Other info worth noting: We stream via a wi-fi connection and had to switch internet providers almost as soon as we got this TV. Our old DSL connection only delivered about 3mps (and couldn't do better because of our distance from the transformer), which was insufficient for streaming to more than one device at a time. We switched to a cable internet service, which generally gives us about 15mps, and with that we can stream videos on at least 5 devices simultaneously.

Reviews.Title: Vizio 42in Smart TV
Reviews.Author: Roo
Reviews.Content: I researched extensively and read many reviews before selecting this TV. I felt confident I was getting the most for the cost with minimal chance of dissatisfaction. First, I have been very happy with the quality of the picture, multiple features and available apps, all making it more than 'just a TV'.What I am dissatisfied with is the poor quality of sound when using the feature of watching an Amazon Instant Video. When I turn the volume up loud enough to hear anything, I get a base vibration and reverb from the internal TV speakers. I tried decreasing the preset base level but that did not help.It appears this is only a problem when using the wifi and viewing amazon instant video download.I would not have purchased if I had been aware.

Reviews.Title: Vizio
Reviews.Author: K. Lacey
Reviews.Content: Great tv. Very good price. I already own 1 Vizio , 32 inch HD for 3 years, no problems. Vizio is very good brand.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Eric B
Reviews.Content: I love the TV. The picture is great. It even displays OTA programming information, something my other 2 HDTVs will not do. However, the smart apps are painfully slow. I was hoping I would free up my Roku box, but I still need it because the apps that are built in are so slow they are unusable. It is the only thing preventing me from giving it a 5 star review.Just an update. I wrote this review yesterday, and decided to try the apps again last night. Hulu took 2 minutes to come up after just starting the TV. Once up it takes at least a minute before it is responsive to any buttons. Then it froze midway watching the show I selected. I see people say the apps have "average loading times," but there is nothing average about that based on my Xbox, my 2 Rokus, and my Friends' smart TVs.

Reviews.Title: Very good value for entry level TV
Reviews.Author: S. Robinson
Reviews.Content: I like this TV just fine, but gave it the 4 star rating because it is somewhat limited the further you get from watching it "head-on". I didn't notice the same from a 37" Vizio that it replaced. I really goes kind of gray as you move to the side. I am estimating about 120 degrees of decent viewing angle. This is just fine for my wife and I to watch, as we only sit a couple feet apart, at most.The sound is not bad, out of the stock speakers. It's better than the 37" above, even though there doesn't seem to be much room in the bezel to locate speakers. I'm sure that a sound bar or home theater system would be great, but it's OK for news, TV shows, etc.I'm watching this TV in a 12' x 14' living room, corner to corner and it's adequate. I'm sure that the charts would have me with a 60" TV, but this one is decent.At the $500 price that I got this for, I feel I got a good deal. I'd do it again at that price, but not sure about the $600 I'm seeing it for since then. That's probably still OK, but I might have done a bit more comparing at that price.The TV does have WiFi and was a very easy set-up. I don't use apps much, but the WiFi is a definite plus when I do.

Reviews.Title: Awesome !!!!
Reviews.Author: Rick White
Reviews.Content: Works Excellent in all aspects. I have a hard time elaborating because the product is absolutely "Great" Great! Great !

Reviews.Title: Defective TV and slow customer service
Reviews.Author: M. Cramer
Reviews.Content: The picture is pretty good but there have been minor and major issues with the TV.  The first was it arrived 3 days after the scheduled date on the package tracking system meaning I took two days off of work and waited around all day Saturday since I had to sign for the package.  The TV takes a good 20 secs or so to turn on which is odd.  The Vizio logo comes up initially and then the screen goes black for 10-15 secs before starting to come back up so you don't know if it is really turning on.  The TV worked great for the first week or so but then started getting this purple tint and color blotches periodically.  It continued to get worse over the next week until it was almost constant and everything was purple.  I called Vizio who requested I email pictures of the problem and said they would respond within 48 hours.  Six days later they called and said they would send another TV but it would take 8 to 11 working days.  I asked if they could expedite the process since they were 4 days late in responding and Vizio said no although the gal was apologetic.  That was a few days ago so I can't say when it will actually arrive.  Consequently, I am not impressed with Vizio or the TV at the moment and did not get a chance to try out the internet services so I can't speak to that.

Reviews.Title: Vizio Smart TV Almost Hooks Itself Up
Reviews.Author: Max McCartney
Reviews.Content: This Vizio is a great TV. Had it out of the box and hooked to my cable in 30 minutes. This also included the Netflix hook up. It has a crystal clear picture with vivid color. I did ad a sound bar to mine .

Reviews.Title: this is a great reasonably priced TV
Reviews.Author: Beckie Campbell
Reviews.Content: I would consider buying this TV from this seller again. It arrived fast, and it is in great condition, and works beautifully. I installed several of these in a youth room in a church and the kids love them. I have not had any issues with them yet

Reviews.Title: Great tv
Reviews.Author: Mark8373
Reviews.Content: I don't use it for the apps I use it mainly for my computer monitor and it looks great sounds great and only required a little tweaking I would recommend this tv to anyone wanting a good picture for a great price.

Reviews.Title: vizio led smart hdtv
Reviews.Author: Kathy M.
Reviews.Content: This was exactly what we wanted in a tv - it was so easy to order and actually arrived BEFORE the expected delivery date. No problems, no issues - it was up and running within about 15 minutes. Would definitely recommend seller to anyone who expects good service and a quality tv for this price.

Reviews.Title: great tv
Reviews.Author: Starr Wells-Quinn
Reviews.Content: love this tv, it fits well with our space and is just the right size, picture is great, so glad we went with this one

Reviews.Title: Nice TV
Reviews.Author: dmm
Reviews.Content: I like this tv. I'm just not able to get a great sound that is crystal clear and haven't been able to figure out how to make adjustments to make it better.  It may not be the tv though since it's in a room with a high ceiling that opens to an upper loft.The picture is clear and sharp since I've followed some of the suggestions from earlier reviews with directions for setting and am happy with the results.  I'm not tech savvy so some of this is a little overwhelming at times but for the most part I am happy with this tv.

Reviews.Title: AWEEEEEEEEEEESOME
Reviews.Author: Jennifer Faulk
Reviews.Content: I received this today from Amazon and all i can say is that this is a very awesome tv once i got thru the settings all i can say is WOW

Reviews.Title: Quality is not bad
Reviews.Author: Shelly Lo
Reviews.Content: The look and size are ok, but it's thicker on the back than my LG and Samsumg TV. I believe that's why it's heavier than the other two. It's a slow start-up TV. Hit th power button and takes about 10 seconds to see the image. If you have HD channel, this TV shows in very good quality for it. When switch to regular analog channel, it's a bit blurring.

Reviews.Title: Great buy... Remote is questionable
Reviews.Author: GW "Gwaite300"
Reviews.Content: This is a great tv for the money. The picture isn't superior but it is good, you'll need to spend an $600 and up in you want this feature set with better picture. But the remote? I dont care that it looks flimsy, I just need it to work. It stopped working after a month, changed the batteries and still nothing. Typically I wouldnt care but you need the remote to use the smart tv features. We'll see.

Reviews.Title: Great for amazon prime
Reviews.Author: Keith Brouca "THe Gonz"
Reviews.Content: Love that I can go right on prime, no real problems with youtube either. Just discovered the USB feature so I can do thigns with that now too. Thanks!

Reviews.Title: Great Tv
Reviews.Author: Peter W.
Reviews.Content: PROS- The Price!- Looks Great- Picture is Top notch- USB?- It has Apps....- Remote is cool when it's responsiveCONS- Garbage Apps- LAG- LAG- Keep waiting for those Apps to loadI ordered it here at Amazon, really great price: http://amzn.to/12pIAAk

Reviews.Title: Terrific for the price. Works wonderfully with a computer as well
Reviews.Author: B. Duke "A moderate"
Reviews.Content: So far the television has been terrific for the price. High resolution. Sleek, handsome design. Let me say upfront that I do not use this television as many would. I do not have it hooked up to a cable, nor do I use it to receive local television channels (although it does have this option as well.) I use it in three ways:1) I connect to my wireless router and use the apps (primarily Amazon of course!)2) I have this hooked up to my computer via a (very long) HDMI cable and watch streaming movies and television shows from the internet or my own collection.3) I occasionally insert a USB flash drive directly into the USB port and play movies that way.The television performs all three tasks well.First, the built in wireless receiver has worked pretty well so far with some initial buffering lags. Although I've streamed movies this way, it's not the most flawless way to watch them - for that, I recommend method 2 or 3 below.Second, I have the TV hooked up to my computer using an HDMI cable (the preferred method) which works nicely as well. In this capacity, I merely use the TV as a second monitor and play files from my computer or stream from the internet. The resolution is as good as the TV would be if it were playing movies or TV programs directly from a DVD (at least to my eye). One note if you want to do this yourself: you will need to go to your control panel and activate a second monitor and also go to your sound controls and activate the TV as primary. This is pretty easy to do - I am not really above average in technical skill.Third, I occasionally play videos directly from a USB flash drive that I insert into the USB port. When I plug a flash drive in, the TV recognizes it and asks if I would like to browse the content. I then have the option of playing a video on the drive. So far I have only tried this with .avi files but it works well. You can control the playback with the controller that comes with the television (it has pause and fast forward buttons, although the FF button does not advance the movie very quickly.)All in all this TV works wonderfully for what I bought it for. That said, the only thing that prevents me from rating 5 stars is the sound - which can be a bit tinny. The built-in speakers are certainly not ideal for quality sound but are generally good enough for the basics. At slightly higher volumes, sounds at both ranges of the spectrum cause problems. The second issue is that you must access the app store to download what should be some common apps (like the Amazon app) for the first time and occasionally I've found that this app does not always activate properly. However, once it does it works fine. The directions on how to download apps is not entirely clear. The "app store" application is not very clearly labeled and doesn't match how it's labeled in the directions. (It's the "connected TV store")Despite these issues, overall I'm very happy with the purchase.

Reviews.Title: No web browser.
Reviews.Author: J. F. Scott "Trekker"
Reviews.Content: This is a good TV.  Really nice picture, good sound.  But for being a "smart" TV (access to Netflix, etc.) you would think it would have some kind of web browser, Safari or Firefox or something.  A little disappointed in having to hook up a laptop to do web access to things like email and general browsing.

Reviews.Title: Not for the impatient
Reviews.Author: Kristina Worth
Reviews.Content: Sharp look and great features for the right price too.  However, powering up this TV seems to take forever. It fits my needs.

Reviews.Title: Great TV for the money
Reviews.Author: Daniel P. Carlberg
Reviews.Content: In looking for a tv to replace my dying Samsung.  I found this and thought I would give it a chance due to what others had said about Vizio and the features that come on this TV standard.  The Wi-Fi and apps make this TV very versatile.  The picture looks great and its LED which is a huge plus.  This TV is actually smaller than the 40" Samsung I replaced it with due to the extremely thin boarder around the screen.  The only down side is the TV starts up slower than my other LEDs.  I think this is due to trying to load the apps and wi-fi before it comes on.  Don't get me wrong it is less than a minute but compared to my Sony there is a noticeable difference.  This is the only reason I didn't give it 5 stars.  Great TV for the Money.

Reviews.Title: Love the built-in wifi
Reviews.Author: Eileen Chang
Reviews.Content: Love the fact that this TV comes with built-in wifi and apps that give you access to Netflix, Hulu Plus, etc. It means you don't need to buy an Apple TV or a Roku, which saves you another $100 on top of the great price of this TV.  Great quality for a good price -- really happy with this purchase!

Reviews.Title: Awesome
Reviews.Author: danno
Reviews.Content: Hands down the best tv i have got yet!! I love the picture and the internet option it gives. Wish it had a search bar!

Reviews.Title: Cool But...
Reviews.Author: Deja
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV for a little more at Wal-Mart because I needed it the same day. I let my family members set it up because I was busy, but from the looks of it they had a little trouble setting it up. I can't speak much on that. But as far as the software set-up upon turning it on, it's a tad annoying. The remote isn't very responsive, the buttons are hard to press, and trying to type the words took a lot longer than it should.Now, I have to say the reason I bought this particular TV is because it was 1080p, a Vizio, could connect to different types of web services, and had a USB port as well as a stunning display. These features were important to me because I don't have cable. I rely on Netflix, Hulu, and downloaded content from my computer to watch. I have a portable hard drive with 60 some movies and TV shows on it which I usually watch through the xbox, but plugging it right up to the TV is an amazing feature. With that being said, the TV is VERY slow in recognizing what is on the disk. Then once it loads, the print is very tiny and hard to read. And the most frustrating part is fast forwarding. There's no skip button, and the fast forward is well, slow forward. It also doesn't recognize all .avi files and claims it doesn't have the codec for it, and no apparent way to get the codec. It still appears better on this TV than the laptop, but the USB is a little pointless for me since I'll still be using it through my xbox.There are a LOT of picture settings to play with. I find that the "game" preset is too bright for actual gaming. The contrast is so high that all the colors blend together, so if you play call of duty, the enemy blends well with everything else. I find that the "movie" preset works well for most things. The internet connectivity is awesome...I never experience any lag from Netflix, but I have noticed that it doesn't stream in full 1080p, the highest it will go is 720. How do I know? Because the TV will tell you the quality of what you're watching. As far as the sound goes, it's okay but I'd still get a sound bar because it doesn't have any depth or bass.It has a very good tuner built inside, the local channels look true HD, but you'll probably need rabbit ears too. I would imagine if you're just watching cable or playing a console most of the time, this TV is awesome. But the same things I bought the TV for are a little pointless. I still love it and would recommend it.UPDATE: I've had this TV for about a year now and it has performed extremely well. The TV occasionally updates itself through the network, and I'm loving the changes. It's much more responsive than before and reads the content on my hard drive fast. Since buying it, I've gotten a PS4 and HD channels and this TV really brings out the power in both. I turned off some features like auto-brightness, true sound, etc and it doesn't use that much electricity. It's on most of the day and through regular use of lights in my apartment my electric bill stays around $30. I moved the rating from 4 stars to 5 stars!

Reviews.Title: Happy so far.
Reviews.Author: Thomas Brown
Reviews.Content: Beautiful HD picture. The Internet apps work well. No compaints at all after a month of use. Great quality / good price.

Reviews.Title: Great Overall Quality for the Price
Reviews.Author: dave415
Reviews.Content: I still cannot believe that I was able to obtain a 42" quality smart TV for $500.  First of all the TV has a slim profile and is very light weight.  It was very simple to set up and connect to my wi-fi.  The picture quality is very good although not spectacular but for $500 it is well worth it. The two complaints I have are that there is no web browser and the viewing angle is very small.  If you have a set up where you would be viewing the TV from more than slightly off center then do not buy this TV.  There definitely are better smart LED tvs out there if you want to spend closer to $1000 but for $500 this TV is a great buy.

Reviews.Title: 120 Hz... hmph
Reviews.Author: Candace Reese
Reviews.Content: When they say 120Hz they really mean a 120 lies. This TV replaced one that I purchased for half the price with a much better picture quality. I guess they think making the picture so big that everything won't fit on screen is HD. I have had this tv for over 6 months and I have yet to see the internet menu displayed at the bottom of the screen. I can get netflix with no problem but I have to trick it to bring up Amazon. If there are choices beyond those two I couldn't tell you. Vizio really should stop selling this TV and be very ashamed of themselves that they ever did.

Reviews.Title: COLOUR CONTOURING AND THE WORST SERVICE EVER STILL NO TV 30 DAYS LATER
Reviews.Author: Gary Kaloostian
Reviews.Content: We have it replaced and they do not even have a new one.  We are supposedly receiving a Reconditioned tv.  Not even one year old and we had to have it replaced.The refurbished one should be here monday september 23 even though we informed them august 30.  They made on attempt but the gentleman said he could not get it off the wall.  Is this not his job?  My husband came home and it took him 30 seconds to remove from bracket prepare for new exchange and take the brackets off the tv so he could replace them just in case the next "delivery guy/gal" cannot get it done either.No More Vizio.... unless of course the refurbished one poops out.  We bought the 4 year warranty ---OMG I hope we do not need it.!!!!Update it is now Sept 27, 2013 we filed the report Aug 30, 2013 still no service no tv just excuses. and where the hell is amazon in this process no where to be seen.

Reviews.Title: Fairly good TV
Reviews.Author: m. b.
Reviews.Content: The vizio has fairly good picture quality and sound.  It gives you a decent amount of tuning options for those who want to calibrate it, and is inexpensive.  Overall, most would be happy with the picture and sound. (very good, just not great)The main problem that I have with this TV (and it's what makes me give it 3stars instead of 4) is that the reason I bought it is because it is a smart TV and I'd be able to stream Netflix without the need for an external device.Big mistake.  The built-in Netflix app on this TV is HORRIBLE!  I'm not sure if it's the app specifically or the TV's software in general... but half the time, netflix fails to load, the other half the time it stops and buffers mid-move.  Even when it does work, the menu is slow to load, and sometimes even that locks up.  My PS3 and Samsung TV in my bedroom (also a smart TV) work MUCH better at streaming Netflix.Conclusion:  Good TV, but Netflix is bad on it.  Not a bad purchase, but if all you care about is TV (no netflix) you can save $40-50 by buying a comparable Vizio that is NOT a "smart" TV.

Reviews.Title: AN EXCELLENT CHOICE WITH HIGH RATINGS FROM PREVIOUS OWNERS.
Reviews.Author: Tom Ball
Reviews.Content: Unit arrived on time and in excellent condition.  Unpacking and set up was accomplished by two people within 30 minutes.  Adapting the Direct TV remote was easy resulting in complete control of unit with just one remote.  Adjusting Color, Tint an brightnesswas simple and easy.  I am very happy with Amazon, the cost and the Vizio TV unit.THANKS TO BOTH AMAZON AND VIZIO!!!

Reviews.Title: Very dissatisfied
Reviews.Author: Brandon Wendt
Reviews.Content: Paid extra for 120hz refresh rate that is supposed to reduce judder and blurring. NOT WORTH IT! I am currently trying to watch playoff basketball in HD and its obnoxious how often the picture gets blurry. Also, there is a line down the middle of the screen that appears when the image is mostly one color like the floor of the basketball court.

Reviews.Title: Perfect! but, sometimes lags/is slow
Reviews.Author: Andrew Kreft
Reviews.Content: I was looking for an HD 1080p LED Internet accessible TV and this one answered my dream with a perfect price! (around 500$).After 3 months of use, the TV is still running perfectly. The "Wigets"/Apps are customizable and you can download alot more (for free or for price) based off 'YAHOO!' wiget/app store. (For example, I downloaded Pandora off of it for free and I can play Pandora through my TV).The ONLY con/ problem I've had with the TV is that sometimes it is slow/ lags based on input, to load the wigets/apps. It takes some patience when loading up HULU or NETFLIX but, once you get into the wiget/app it works as intended.Also, sometimes it will drop connection to wireless and you have to refresh your movie/show you are watching (This may be my internet connection)  However, I think it may be the TV being particular on how good of signal it wants to get with wireless.But, that is nitpicking; All in all this TV looks, sounds and is great! highly reccommend it!

Reviews.Title: Great picture, good sound, great features-albeit a little slow.
Reviews.Author: Mark B.
Reviews.Content: I shopped around a lot and researched pretty much every TV in this price/size range.  I was specifically looking for an LED 1080 120Hz in the 36-48" range.  We have another older (6 years?) larger Vizio which was handed down to me that has been a pretty good TV, although I had to put a new control board in it after about 5 years of use ($100 part and 1 hour of time).  This TV is about 1/2 as thick and much much better screen, although the other is also a 1080p.  The web apps are nice, but they are very slow to load.  Much of the time I end up not thinking I pressed the button correctly and overstepping the menus while it plays catch up, (doesn't matter the connection speed, it's the processing power of the TV.)  Once connected to the web apps, it streams reliably on every app I've tried.  Menu functions are standard and the remote is standard as well, it's not a keyboard remote.Great TV for the money and comparatively.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: JSilan
Reviews.Content: Great TV for the price.  Picture presets are not quite as brilliant as a Samsung or Sony but you simply can't beat the convenience of a smart TV.  After adjusting the picture based on some of the other reviewers' suggestions, you can make it look less dull.

Reviews.Title: Excellent purchase
Reviews.Author: DIY-ers
Reviews.Content: Excellent quality, color, picture  and clarity. Easy to setup and does what it says and easy to use. Costco had a smaller one, not as good a brand,  for 3 times the cost. Was a little hesitant purchasing a TV this way but am very happy that I did. It was packed extremely well and arrived expeditiously.

Reviews.Title: Very good Value.
Reviews.Author: F. Gomez
Reviews.Content: This is the 2nd flat panel purchased within the month.  Purchased this via Walmart.  Amazon did not have this in stock at th time.  This 42" was put for my bed room.  Fantastic picture for the price.  One can't be too picky: Size vs. price value.  My specific rating. - Picture quality 5/5, it's no Samsung, but I also saved $250 for a Samsung of the same size - Overall Set up 5/5, very simple - Set up to my home wi-fi, 5/5, much easier than the 46" Samsung purchased the month prior - Remote control, 3.5/5, This is probably the flimsiest remote I own.  I use it for set up only - universal remote will be used hereafter. - Side panel buttons, 3.5/5 , buttons are a bit receded and labels are not highlighted (just being picky!) - Stand assembly and quality 5/5, study when using the provided platform - Speaker/sound, 1/5, I believe in good audio!  All my sets are tethered back into a surround receiver (via optical out) for optimal sound. My bed room has a 3.1 system - Input/output accessibility 4/5, rear panel could layout could be optimizedOverall at $500 - what a bargain.  Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: Excellent Product
Reviews.Author: S&L; Artz
Reviews.Content: We are extremely satisfied with this TV! Easy to set-up...took less than 30 minutes. The picture and sound are excellent...crisp and very clear! So far, the WiFi (and apps) all work well...Average loading time. The LED TV is fantastic to watch a live sports game on...you can set the picture to football and other views ..No fuzziness or lag time. We are still learning...the only downside we see is that VIZIO does not include a user manual it can only be viewed online. We find it time intensive to view the manual on line for our questions.My Husband researched TVS for a few weeks before and is was a great Christmas surprise for him! We highly recommend this product.

Reviews.Title: Best $ spent!
Reviews.Author: Corine C. C.
Reviews.Content: Almost immediately after pulling the TV out of the box you can see why a 1080p 42inch would cost you under $500. It looks kind of cheap and is thick. but as soon as you turn it on and play a movie at 1080p its ABSOLUTELY AMAZING I was surprised to discover how light it and the screen is absolutely flawless and still can't believe the picture quality of this TV. it comes very close to my Samsung smart TV, it's definitely on the same level. well worth the money plus it has Netflix, YouTube, Hulu, etc., so that's always a plus. the graphics interface of this TV is a little bit amateurish and it doesn't look well design but hey... It works all the  applications run just fine WiFi connects  quickly and DLNA is a little bit disorganize and strange (still figuring out how to work all features) but for the price i paid, I AM HIGHLY SATISFIED. Probably the best $ I've spent in my life :) If you're thinking about getting this TV, don't think anymore, just trust me go for it!

Reviews.Title: Recommend!
Reviews.Author: Serge Neri
Reviews.Content: Looks great! Sounds decent definitely would recommend separate speakers. The apps are good, I rent and buy amazon movies right from my tv. I do wish it had new apps like the nbc sports app I have on my phone.

Reviews.Title: GREAT TV!
Reviews.Author: Bob Lehmann
Reviews.Content: Easy to get it going and wow, what a picture! Love it and suggest to all friends to buy one if you're looking for a great 42" TV.

Reviews.Title: I love this smart tv
Reviews.Author: david crochet
Reviews.Content: I've had this tv for over a year and it continues to work great. I'm sure there are better tvs on the market since this is an old model, but if you can get a deal on it, go for it.

Reviews.Title: no reason not to buy this tv
Reviews.Author: April Edwards
Reviews.Content: I have owned this tv for over a year now and I love all of it smart tvs are awesome. Picture is beautiful sound is kind of iffy, I would suggest a sound bar or something of the sort if you have a lot of people living with you or always have company being just me and me kids the sound isn't an issue

Reviews.Title: Great tv
Reviews.Author: gerald carlson
Reviews.Content: It's a great tv for the price,but it has its drawbacks ,it is very slow about getting data from my wi-fi and switching from hd tv to standard tv.

Reviews.Title: Really nice TV
Reviews.Author: Kevin C.
Reviews.Content: Picture is really good and the apps are very convenient and easy to use. I would definitely recommend this TV.

Reviews.Title: NICE!  Picture is awesome,
Reviews.Author: David Tomato
Reviews.Content: Wall mounted and added 42" Vizio Soundbar 2.1.  Great features and fantastic picture quality. Will be buying the 55" soon.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic
Reviews.Author: Phoebe
Reviews.Content: I bought this tv as a Christmas gift for my mom. After telling me how "I shouldn't have," I helped her set it up and she absolutely loves it. It's an excellent product, and the setup was very easy. My only complaint would be that we were supposed to receive 6 screws for the stand, but there were only 3 in the box. It may have just been a one time accident, but the missing screws cause the tv to be very wobbly on the stand. So we have to be very cautious until we're able to get a few more screws.

Reviews.Title: Sound goes in and out
Reviews.Author: liz davis
Reviews.Content: I love Amazon and will continue doing all my shopping on Amazon. I would have thought though with ordering a new Vizio and not a refurbished version I would be in the clear with issues like sound and a blemish on the 55 inch but not so.When you are watching the 42 inch the sound randomly fades out. The 55 inch came out of the box with a blemish on the screen and I should have just called them immediately but wanted paid someone to help me mount it on the wall so I waited and have missed my window not but will call customer service to see if they can do anything at this late date.

Reviews.Title: A great TV
Reviews.Author: Scott W Stolsenberg
Reviews.Content: This is our fist flat screen TV and we have not been disappointed. Although I have to state that when this TV first arrived, it had a crack in it. But Amazon very quickly arranged for a replacement and within a couple days, we had our TV in perfect condition. We do not watch TV a lot, but we especially enjoy being able to stream movies from Netflix directly to this TV. Because this is the first TV we have had of this type, I can not tell you how it compares to anything like it. We had a small CRT style TV before and this blows that experience away. Thank you to Amazon for having such a fast and friendly return policy.

Reviews.Title: Thought I loved it and then it stopped working...
Reviews.Author: Meredith Parks
Reviews.Content: Just received this tv - the plastic film is still on the edges and it stopped working within three weeks of getting it set up, not sure if the remote is bad or it is something wrong with the set.Hopefully I can get a return resolved quickly and the next set I get works.

Reviews.Title: Too used!
Reviews.Author: Deborah Jane
Reviews.Content: This worked 10 times from the first time I turned it on in May.  It was a great tv to  start with.  Then all sorts of green and red lines are all over screen.  If you get a good used one you can save money but this one was a  real hastle.

Reviews.Title: Vizio 42" TV 1080p 120Hz LED Smart HDTV
Reviews.Author: J.G.
Reviews.Content: Great TV easy to use.  Can stream Netflix thru it.  My son Plays PS3 games on it.  We watch family movies together on it.  Nice size.  Really good picture quality.

Reviews.Title: Another good Vizio TV
Reviews.Author: Paul
Reviews.Content: Excellent smart TV.  This is my 4th Vizio TV and I have been very happy with all of them.  It has a very nice display and plenty of HDMI and USB ports.  The included apps work well.  You can add or delete apps with ease.  My only complaint is the included remote.  Since the TV comes with the included apps, it should really be bundled with a keyboard remote.  I purchased one separately without any problems from Amazon.  It is super simple to setup and you can calibrate the picture at your convenience.  The default calibration is not too bad, but you can tweak it to your preference.

Reviews.Title: Hard to beat it for the $$
Reviews.Author: John L. Banta "jlbanta"
Reviews.Content: Fantastic  TV for the $$. Great Picture.  Most apps loaded on this TV are lame, Vizio needs to improve the useablility and versatility of most apps. I especially expected the Amazon app to be very versatile. We have a Roku box so we’re used to using that for Amazon videos, the Amazon app on this TV just sucks compared to using the Roku. Overall set up of the TV including Wi-Fi was easy, up & running in minutes. I wish this TV had a Web-Browser but I’m not really complaining, can’t expect everything for the great price I got it for. I love that this TV has 3 HDMI inputs, (unusual for this price range)perfect for our use. One thing that stands out to me is the sound of the speakers. I think this TV sounds very good with just it’s own speakers. Many flat-screens  I’ve seen really leave a lot to be desired in the sound dept. Don’t get me wrong, it ain’t like home theater sound, but it is very clear sound even at higher volumes. We have a Bose wave radio and we use that in substitute of a sound bar when we watch our evening shows and movies etc… The Bose works perfect for this purpose. There are equalizer settings that you can select and customize in the menu options so you can adjust levels to your liking. The remote is easy to get use to as far as the layout, the only complaint I have about it is some of the buttons are a little too small & close together and you end up pressing a wrong one, this can especially happen if you have the lights turned down. I should say that I’ve only had this TV for just over a week now so perhaps I’m writing this review a little too soon but I don’t really expect anything to drastically change with it in the next few weeks/months. I would have given it 5 stars if it weren’t for the problems with apps and the complaint about the remote. Overall it’s a great TV for the $$ I’m happy I bought it and not that I’m an expert but I would recommend it over many others in this same price-range.

Reviews.Title: Best TV for the money...
Reviews.Author: scott482002
Reviews.Content: The best TV, for the price, I've ever purchased. Super picture, nice WI-FI apps and even decent sound. Reviews.Title: My 1st flat screen TV!
Reviews.Author: Latoya Turner
Reviews.Content: I just love it!! and I didn't have to wait long for delivery! My first flat screen television and I have no complaints.

Reviews.Title: Awesome TV
Reviews.Author: Tiago Lopes
Reviews.Content: Probably one of the best TVs I could buy for this price range. Has a lot of apps to install. Love it

Reviews.Title: I gave this TV a five-star rating for only one reason...
Reviews.Author: F. Sartin
Reviews.Content: ...six stars weren't available. Yeah, that's hyperbole in it's simplest form, but I stick by it for another solitary reason... it's a stellar VALUE.  Considering its terrific picture quality (good black levels, very good color saturation, excellent resolution, contrast level and (lack of) motion artifacts), adequate number of apps pre-installed, simple setup and pleasant physical aesthetics, it handily wins an "Entry-Level-No-Brainer-@-$470 Award."  Maybe even the "Best of" in that category.While irrelevant to this review, I getta chuckle comparing this Vizio to the $600 26" Mits CRT I owned in the early nineties.  Also  under the same qualifier, I can't help but wince when I consider that my brother paid ~$1500 for a 42" Vizio plasma just a handful of years ago... whatta long way we've come, eh?Now, if I must pick nits, the Vizio's stereo speakers are barely better than a 1970 VW Beetle's radio speaker, and the remote control is dinky, cheap plastic & non-illuminated - but who cares on either count?!?  You're not buying a 42" display for audiophile-grade sound, and a metal, backlit wand would look ridiculous in situ, right?  Yeah, I think so, too...Anyway, hook up a good source or two (I use an Oppo BDP-103 & DirecTV HD DVR) and plug in to your two-channel or surround system and you'll be rewarded with terrific A/V entertainment.  Job well done, Vizio.

Reviews.Content: Sound - If you sitting in a big room, max volume is not enough. Quality is just average. A lot needs to be done in this area.Video. - OK. Haven't had any issues. But it takes about a minute to get the video.The base does not have swivel feature which I really hate.If you are someone that spends a lot of time watching TV, this is not the one.

Reviews.Content: The good: great HD picture, 3 HDMI inputs, Wifi and wired internet capability, pre-programmed buttons for some internet apps especially Netflix (other apps are available via menu), low energy useThe bad: remote control unit and buttons are small and hard to operate 'one handed', broadcast SD (480p) picture is sub par (there are multiple adjustments available for the picture, maybe I haven't found the right combination), only one set of non HDMI inputs for either a component or a composite device

Reviews.Content: what i can i say its awesome!...I have it hanging on the wall and use it for my PC and my PS3. Looks great, good size, great for gaming.

Reviews.Title: Good TV, Great Picture
Reviews.Author: chicagocubsfanSLC
Reviews.Content: We've had this television for three months now. It was our first LED TV and I'm so glad we picked one that connects to the internet. We've loved being about to watch YouTube, Amazon and Netflix straight from the tv without connecting a computer to it.I've seen some reviews that say you should buy or set up speakers with this tv and I think in some cases that is true. I find when we're watching movies the sound sometimes sounds hollow or theme music overpowers what actors are saying. However, watching sports events and news, I haven't noticed any problems. We do have speakers we will be connecting to our television.The tv connects to WiFi but right now we have the internet hard wired into our tv simply because our internet connection isn't that great. Once we upgrade our internet service we will connect to the internet that way.Over all, a great television, especially for the price. We also love the 42" size. We looked at going bigger but now having it for a few months, we've decided this is the best size for us.

As far as gaming, I have yet to test this tv with my XBox or hdmi connection to pc(no vga for pc).The only "con" is that the sound could be better. The speakers are in the back and thus are not as loud as I would like them to be, but otherwise they work perfectly for 96% of all my uses.

Reviews.Title: Delivery was prompt.  Product is as expected.

Reviews.Title: Vizio 42 smart led tv
Reviews.Author: Zoe
Reviews.Content: Everything works great and picture quality is great. The apps works great. Get wifi connection and watch movies through Netflix all day!!!

Reviews.Title: 5 STAR FOR THIS ONE
Reviews.Author: Phyllis M. Adams "Phydee"
Reviews.Content: I've had this for 4 months now and I am so pleased that I chose this one.I have another Vizio and my Brother has 4 Vizio's and none have had any problems.First, the price was nice for the options and the fact that it is an LED and because of the size, I was able to put it in an area that I thought I couldn't go any larger then a 39 inch.I do want to address the fact that yes, the first thing is to shut off the low lighting that the TV is set for. It's too bad people have returned this TV because they didn't realize it arrives set for the bedroom atmosphere and that is too bad.  I'm more surprise that Vizio actually has this turned on when new and not set at the normal setting. So, the picture didn't look too good.  Once this is off, it's now a WOW effect.I think the colors are vibrant and you can do all kinds of adjustments that are your preference.I wanted this TV for the formal living room where I just want to relax and watch some television.  I am not into all the Netflix and the other things that it can do...just wanted a nice size television with a great picture.  I have a large Sony all set for another room where the movies and Netflix is used...but I must say, I believe this one has a better picture...not by much as the Sony cost me 3 times the price of this one and also has a nice picture.When I lost my entire home in a fire, I never bought another Bose system for any televisions...just not a priority and I can honestly say, I haven't missed it.  I like the speakers on this television, sounds ok to me and they are on the front and not the side...which can make a difference. I'm in my 50's now, guess the surround system really isn't missed now. I have it on a nice television table with underneath drawers but it would be great even to hang on the wall...the size is just perfect being the LED.  I never would have had a 42 inch TV in this area...like I said, was originally looking at no larger then a 39.  It does take about 20 seconds to come on as it downloads data, but that doesn't bother me at all  Believe me, I fill that 20 seconds with something else to do.I would recommend this TV to anyone and when you deal with Amazon, if there is a problem, they stand behind the product should there be something wrong with it or comes damaged.  The box did have a small dent in it, had that kind of panic for a moment hoping the screen and everything was ok, but it was pretty well packed inside.For this kind of money, you get a very nice TV without having to spend another few hundred dollars.  My other Vizio I have had for 5 years now, picture is great, colors...perfect and have never had a problem with it.  Funny, how now we have Televisions in a number of rooms...not the 50's and 60's anymore...if you get it...enjoy it. Oh, before I forget, it seems when looking at TV's, the LCD TV's are not putting much into extra's...think they just want to go all LED now..you may already know that.

Reviews.Title: good value

Reviews.Title: This is a beautiful TV, but...
Reviews.Author: R. Vining "X Rays R Me"
Reviews.Content: The picture is stunningly beautiful, and there are different settings to adjust the image to almost any preference. The sound quality seems OK to me, although I'm not exactly an audiophile. I'm very happy with this TV, however I didn't give it 5 stars because:To connect to our home network I needed the WIFI MAC address. I was able to find it eventually, but it was way harder than it should have been. The MAC address should be provided to you, you shouldn't have to search for it. It's not on a sticker on the back where the serial # and model # are. It's nowhere in the manual. The manual just refers you to a website. The website never heard of a MAC address. It's buried in a help menu you'll come across when you're exploring the settings. I did a google search of "how to find the MAC address of a Vizio TV", and found a YouTube video explaining how to get to it.Anything connecting to the internet will require typing e-mail addresses, user names, and passwords, movie and TV show titles etc. There's a lot of typing involved and the remote doesn't have any keyboard or mouse. There's 4 directional tab buttons and an OK button. This setup works, but I thought I left this sort of thing, tabbing around, behind like 30 years ago. I hate the feeling that any second now every smart TV will start to come with a remote that has a qwerty keyboard available, real or touchscreen. Maybe it will be possible to upgrade this model to a new aftermarket remote, but then I'll have to buy that as an additional cost...To be fair most other TVs don't have a better way of typing inputs from users yet either.This TV has the best picture quality out there in this price range, period.My biggest frustration isn't really with this specific TV at all, it's with all the smart TVs I looked at - the remote is not as smart as the TV. My previous 1999 vintage glass CRT TV had a remote with the same technology and more buttons than this one.

Reviews.Title: As expected

Reviews.Title: nice!
Reviews.Author: Jamie L. Martin "Lightning Reader"
Reviews.Content: i didn't expect much of this tv for the price but we love it!! picture is amazing and i love the small bevel around the edge.*** though i do have to warn if you are used to the older flat screens with larger bevel you might want to go up a size or two if you can afford it.*** we had an older plasma that had huge bevel and this tv is so much slimmer it seems smaller than it's 42" size. i should have spent the extra $100 on the 47". we have had this tv for a few months now and my favorite part is the picture quality.pros: great picture even with light from windows. great looking mounted to the wall. a wide variety of screen settings based on whether you are watching different type of sports, gaming etc.cons: with the smaller tv size it did not come with a keyboard type remote a small hassle but in no way a real negative against the tv. i do have to say though the sound is somewhat lacking. we have a open like floor plan and it's good most of the time but with the kids playing etc i do have to turn it up quite a bit. i think a sound bar would be a wise investment with this tv. but it's more than good for the average tv watcher!the thing that does bug me a little is the load time for when the tv starts up. i have to turn it on and get a snack etc. Hulu seems especially slow. but that could be a mix of the tv load time and hulu.overall very satisfied with the price and back lit LED smart tv, i think this is a great purchase. when i save up i will be getting the larger one and putting this one in the kids room! i recommend this tv. i gave it 4 stars because of the sound. good enough for the average tv watcher but if you are a sound nut ya might want to get a sound bar :)

Reviews.Title: Fantastic

Reviews.Title: Good Tv
Reviews.Author: P. Pieri
Reviews.Content: When I first got this TV the picture was bad. I then adusted all to what I like and now the picture is awesome. The colors, the clarity is very crisp. I sit about 8 feet from the screen and it look amazing. I have a Samsung and a LG and I put this one pretty close in picture quality to both of them. I am partial to samsung but being a senior I need to save money where I can. This TV cost about $150.00 less than the samsung and the picture quality is pretty close. The sound is good. I had a cabinet for the TV but it was not wide enough so I put an extended shelf on it and put the TV on it. With it that way the speakers sound goes down so the shelf block the sound. I then cut the shelf so the TV fit on the center and I cut the corners off and then the sound was good. I would say that most LCD TV's are this way. I had the same problem with the samsung and LG. I did the same and made a shelf with the ends cut off. The remote is kind of flimsy but it works okay. The apps are good. I have Amazon prime so I can get videos free and it works good.Pros: Picture quality, Thin edgeCons: remote, speaker placement(kind of hard to go anywhere else)1 other problem is that there is about a 30 sec delay after you turn on the TV and my satelite before you get a picture. On my Samsug and LG it is instant. Being IT Pro this kind of scares me.I did get a 4 year Warranty with Square trade because I hears that with Vizio TV's that after 1 year they say they are unfixable if you have a panel problem.Update 1/1/14 This TV is so so. The delay between changing channels is awful. I have a LG and there is no delay on this tv you can go out of the room and come back in and it still has not change channels. When you turn it on there is at least a 30-45 sec wait for the picture to come on. I am sorry I did not buy a better brand. I have Comcast now and I still have this problem. It drives me crazy. Even to make matters worst is that sometimes it does change channels fast but I don't know why the difference. I am tempted to junk this TV but I have a four year warranty and so I will keep it. It would be nice if Visio would fix this problem. I have also had problem with the smart tv part of this. It constantly will not let me into Amazon. I have Amazon prime and I cannot watch it on this TV and that is one of the reason I got this. For people who think they should spend money for a smart Tv be smart and buy a aux box that you can used on different TV's and save yourself a lot of money. I have apps on this TV and on my LG and I use them maybe 1% of the time compare to watching TV. I have a WD media device that I used at my Second place and I am sorry I did not get another one here. I am lowering my rating on this TV to 2 Stars.

Reviews.Title: Great!
Reviews.Author: S. Miller
Reviews.Content: I lovw this TV.  It's just the right size and the sound and picture are great!  The smart feature is a lot of fun too.

Reviews.Title: Great TV! Great Price!

Reviews.Content: For someone who would never buy a Vizio, I love this TV. The picture is top notch with 1080p and 120 HZ along with a 2 million:1 contrast ratio, you couldn't ask for more. Reviews.Content: The VIZIO TV is a brand of TV that I had not tried before. I have had it for a while and I think it is a good product.
