Reviews.Author: KARTHICK SUNDARAM
Reviews.Content: Great in all aspects, expect it takes a while while changing from non-HD channel to HD channels. I have other TV which is samsung but it does not have this problem.

Reviews.Title: TV Firmware and "Dock" are buggy, not ready for prime-time, return process for TVs is a real pain
Reviews.Author: Dean
Reviews.Content: We purchased the 42" Vizio over the Samsung as it was 42" vs. 40" and 120 Hz vs. 60 Hz.  For some reason, my gut was telling me not to get the Vizio and to stick with the Samsung, but the Vizio was purchased nonetheless.When attempting to watch Netflix, Hulu, or Amazon Prime content, the entire set would lock-up.  Sometimes, it would begin responding again after a few minutes.  Other times, it would never come back and the system could only be recovered by pulling the power cable.  Factory resets of both the firmware and the "dock" software did not change this behavior.It appears there are other firmware-related issues with this Vizio series and while the specs on paper seem great, it simply did not work out that way for us.Amazon is always great about returns and agreed to return the TV.  Purchasing a TV on Amazon though, is something that compelled me to write this review.  I strongly encourage every customer who reads this, to reconsider purchasing a TV from Amazon or online in general.  While their customer service has been great about returns, the entire burden of the return process is on the customer.  UPS and Amazon do not communicate, so it took multiple phone calls and failed UPS visits for both companies to get on the same page about the Call Tag from UPS.  Amazon will not refund the money until they either have the TV in their possession or after we pushed a bit, they agreed they could issue the refund once they saw it had reached a service center.  That is going to take another 24-48 hours for their systems to update.So what was supposed to be a purchase that brought a new TV into the house for use by Tuesday, has turned into 4 days of phone calls, re-packing a TV, and up to two weeks for a refund (unless we call in again and 'push' to have them issue a refund sooner).You're better walking in to your local big-box store so you can test the TV, check all the features you want, and then return the TV and get a new one the same day, should there be issues.  We love our Amazon Prime account and for small items, this is great.  It's so easy to click and add it to your cart, but it's definitely not the same convenience level if something goes wrong.  TVs and larger items, we'll probably only look locally from here on out.

Reviews.Content: This tv has nice picture quality and is very thin.  I am happy with my purchase, but I do not like the smart tv applications.  The system is not very user friendly and there is a lot of lag time when selecting and navigating through programs.  I also do not like the remote.  It makes loud clicking noises when pushing the buttons and it makes me feel like I'm using old technology.I give four stars for picture quality and two stars for user friendliness and for the cheesy remote.I would still recommend this tv for $500.

Not only did it have everything I wanted in a smart tv, but the price as unreal!  Customer service was great on helping me to set it up....A+

I bought to get Netflix.  Had I known all the mumbo jumbo about the server issues I would not have bought it. Still trying to decide whether to send it back.  Very disappointed!!

Reviews.Title: One minor detail
Reviews.Author: R. W. Roberts
Reviews.Content: If you plan to mount the TV on the wall, you will not be using the base plate. This means that there is going to be an opening in the bottom of the TV where you would be inserting the post for the stand.While it is a minor thing and does not alter the image on the screen.... If it is installed above eye level, you are going to see the interior  of the base mounting area underneath and it stands out. I am not sure why they did not include a cover plate for the hole. It looks kinda crappy when the rest of the frame is black and the silver internal area can be seen.I am not sure how long it takes for other TVs to turn on but you can expect to wait 23 seconds before the screen activates and displays what is on TV.Also, the sound that plays thru the TV is NOT in sync with my other TVs. So if I have a TV on nearby... I hear an irritating echo.

Reviews.Title: Vizio = junk

What I can't live with is having the sound on tv stop working when I change the channel! I have to turn off cable box and tv, then turn back on for sound to work. Never buy this crap brand again.

Reviews.Title: Not what I had hoped....
Reviews.Author: MC Korman
Reviews.Content: I've had this TV for about 8mos now.  I wouldn't recommend it.  For some reason there are frequent lonnnnng delays when changing channels (I have Verison Fios).  There's not particular pattern, but no other TV in my house does this, so I can only assume it's the poor quality of this set.  Also, at the top right of the screen when initially turning the set on, it indicates the resolution. When viewing high definition programing, it always says 720psi. I've reviewed the settings meticulously, and no matter how I configure it, I can't get true high definition 1080.  As a result, the picture is only average, and not terribly sharp as you'd expect with a HD tv.  In all, this set has been a disappointment and will be the last off-brand purchase I'll make.  Next time I'll shell out the extra $50-100 and purchase a Samsung or Sony.  sigh....

Reviews.Title: DO NOT BUY!
Reviews.Author: Idiosyncracy "Mista Mista"

Reviews.Title: Misleading Specs
Reviews.Author: Christopher Smith "Jamaican"
Reviews.Content: 120hz is a deciding factor when purchasing a TV for many customers, myself included, so when a manufacturer purposely misleads customers, we have a right to be upset. I've bought several Vizio's over the years and recommended it to many, the biggest factor for all those purchases was 120hz. When Vizio listed that spec in the past, we all knew what it meant, it meant the option to enable and disable the "soap opera" effect. I've only bought 120hz and up TV's in the past few years, so I am accustomed to having the feature on as it dramatically reduces motion blur and adds a nice effect. So when Vizio listed the spec here, I would not think I needed to investigate further to discover that they have changed their definition of what it means. The spec has a universal implication as I said, we all know what it means and what it's supposed to do, but in this case, what does Vizio mean by that spec if it doesn't have smooth motion?Can I connect a computer to the TV and select 120hz as the refresh rate? NODoes this TV process the frames and double them artificially to reduce motion blur? NO (thus the blurriness)So what does Vizio mean by listing the spec "120hz?"I spoke to William at Vizio's online chat and this was his explanation:"It's performing like a 60hz TV because of the input source.  The TV's processing 60hz twice.  It really needs the smooth motion algorithm to stitch those frames together."So, if it needs smooth motion to make it perform like 120hz, and it doesn't have this, HOW CAN YOU LIST IT IN THE SPECS?!  Also, I tested all input sources and the blurriness was still very much present.This is a 60hz TV which they are passing off as 120hz to all those gullible enough to purchase it and I know why they did it. Many people turn the effect off on their TV's, when you check sites for recommended calibrations for TV's, most recommend turning the feature off, so Vizio probably thought they could save a few bucks by leaving the feature out on the 47" and below, but then, why list it in the specs?This apparent malicious intent to mislead is why Vizio won't see another cent of my money. I've bought 4 vizio tv's over the years and recommended it to friends who bought another 10, 1 of who ordered the E420i-A1 which I set up for him last night only to discover the blurring mentioned earlier. I stupidly had ordered the 47" to replace my Vizio M3D420SR who's HDMI PORTS have all died (which renders the TV useless since Vizio has no motherboards to fix the issue and have no idea if they will ever get them back in stock). I'm actively trying to cancel the 47" though it already shipped. In this day and age I don't expect to be lied to like this by Vizio, so I'll take my business elsewhere

Reviews.Title: TV OK, Delivery Rotten
Reviews.Author: Proudmale "Proudmale"
Reviews.Content: My siblings and I ordered this TV almost three weeks in advance of our parents 60th anniversary.  Big event for two of the greatest people ever.  Shipping was delayed and delayed until finally about 2:30 in the morning on Friday it was delivered to UPS shipping center in Phoenix AZ.  We figured it was still okay as they only had to travel 730 miles to Salt Lake City over Friday, Saturday, and Sunday -- not to big of a stretch for a shipping giant.  So we left Denver and went to Salt Lake to get ready for the big party.Checked delivery status around noon on Monday, and was promised delivery by 5:00 PM still in time for that evenings party.  When package had not arrived called around 6:00 PM to find out what happened.  UPS told me they did not even get the package until around 5:34 PM and would delivery it the next day.  The supervisor I spoke to told me that the Friday delivery I had seen was for when the shipping label was created and given to UPS, not the delivery of the product.  (Hmm, wonder why the label was sent to Phoenix when the product arrived at the UPS warehouse in Salt Lake -- slow way to deliver a piece of paper??)If you have any kind of a deadline in mind, DO NOT, I repeat DO NOT, rely on Amazon to meet your needs or their published shipping times.  I wish I had spend $20 more and picked it up locally in Salt Lake.  That way two of the finest people it has ever been my pleasure to know would have got their TV at the party instead of a web page print out.Shame on you Amazon -- while I am admittedly not your biggest customer, I have ordered several big ticket items off of you.  Key word was ordered as in will never order in the future.Worse on you UPS --  I will never use you again for any package delivery, nor will I ask for you on any packages I order.
